title: Stacey Dooley 'proud' of boyfriend Kevin Clifton after Strictly exit
text:
Stacey Dooley has said she is proud of boyfriend Kevin Clifton after Strictly exit (Picture: instagram/PA)

Stacey Dooley is Kevin Clifton’s biggest fan and she wants everyone to know it.

The Glow Up host threw her support behind boyfriend Kevin on Sunday night, after he and Anneka Rice were given the boot on Strictly Come Dancing.

Their Kill Bill routine failed to impress, leaving Kevin and Anneka bottom of the leaderboard with 11 points and in the dance off.

Judges voted to save David James and Nadiya Bychkova instead, but that didn’t stop Stacey celebrating Kevin in a sweet post she shared to her Instagram story, following the result.

She insisted it is just as important to show your support when contestants get knocked out, as it is when they’re doing well on the show.

Stacey said Anneka was ‘lucky’ to have been partnered with Kevin (Picture: Instagram)

Stacey told fans: ‘Kev and Anneka got knocked out this weekend and I just want to say I am so proud of both of them, but particularly Kevin because I just think he is the most incredible teacher.’

A little biased (obviously), Stacey added that Anneka was ‘lucky’ to have been partnered with her boyfriend Kevin.

‘It’s very easy to be proud of someone when you are winning and flying high and its all going brilliantly, but it’s also very important to tell them they are wicked when they are second to get knocked out. So yes, well done,’ she said.

Kevin and Anneka’s Kill Bill routine failed to impress (Picture: PA)

Stacey had been partnered with pro dancer Kevin on Strictly in 2018 and they went on to win the show, taking home the coveted Glitterball trophy.

Following the breakdown of her relationship with ex Sam Tucknott, it was revealed Stacey and Kevin are dating.

The duo are usually pretty private when it comes to their romance – with the odd relationship update appearing on social media from time to time – but Stacey has said she and Kevin are very happy.

She told The Guardian: ‘Kev and I agreed not to go into too much detail about our private lives because you can’t really indulge that and then ask for privacy.

‘That’s why we turned down interviews that offered us tens of thousands of pounds. What I am happy to say is Kev’s amazing. I’m happy, life happens. I’ve got an amazing career and I’m very lucky.’
